physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Patient is overweight (BMI: 20.4 kg/mÂ²) and has normal stature (122 cm; -0.58 standard deviation). Hormonal tests reveal mild hypothyroidism (FT4 below normal range). No symptoms of hypothyroidism presented. Normal TSH response to TRH.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Retrospective analysis shows hyperthyrotropinemia at age 6. At age 10, TSH was elevated with decreased FT4 after 1 month off L-T4 treatment, indicating changes in thyroid function.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal TSH and PRL responses to a second TRH test after 1 month off L-T4 treatment. FT4 increase was below normal after TRH administration.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Hyperthyrotropinemia was intermittent among family members, with the patient showing changes in thyroid function over time.
